thread.title: Caitlyn Jenner is scared she’ll end up in men’s jail | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: Caitlyn Jenner is scared she’ll end up in men’s jail | DailyTelegraph

author: Network Writers
title: Caitlyn Jenner is scared she’ll end up in men’s jail | DailyTelegraph
text:
CAITLYN Jenner has broken her silence about the February car crash, which claimed the life of another woman.
Speaking on the Today show in the US, Jenner said she feard being sent to a men’s prison should she be charged with misdemeanour manslaughter.
Prosecutors are now trying to determine if Jenner exercised proper caution and what her role was in the crash that killed 69-year-old Kim Howe. Jenner said she was driving under the 80km speed limit (police have backed up her claim), but remembers little of the crash.
Other Stories Shot by police to prevent rampage News 0 comments Sales’ cutting question for PM Television How Hayne left Aussie businessman devastated More Sports 0 comments How Duran Duran got their groove back Entertainment 0 comments Why being an escort has made me a better mother Rendezview 0 comments ‘Safety is my middle name’ Nsw 0 comments “I remember it happening. That’s about it,” said Jenner. “A tragedy like this, you’ll never get over it. You just learn to live with it the best you possibly can.”
Caitlyn Jenner speaks about new life Jenner also addressed the possibility that she could land in jail.
“The media wants that picture, don’t they?” she said of a potential mugshot.
“That is the worst case scenario. I don’t know. We’ll see. The Men’s County Jail [in Los Angeles] - It is an enormous problem that they would put trans-women in Men’s County Jail.”
Helping Jenner’s case is an US$18.5million ($26 million) lawsuit that was filed against Howe’s estate by the passengers of another car involved in the accident who claim she was the negligent driver.
TMZ is reporting, however, that those same passengers may also sue Jenner (she’s also being sued by Howe’s family as well as the driver of another car involved in the crash).
Deadly drive ... The Februray crash, involving Caitlyn Jenner, killed a 69-year-old woman. Police have said Jenner was driving under the speed limit at the time of the crash. Picture: AP Jenner also spoke about having no regrets since she made the decision to transition earlier this year, saying she feels lucky to have lived her life as a man and a woman.
“I think about my life — and where I’m at in my life right now. What a tremendous experience this is. Hardly anybody gets to live two genders in their life,” she said.
“Everybody wonders, ‘Oh, what’s it like to be coming from the other side? You know, their thinking, the way they act, everything?’
“And here I have the opportunity to do that. And to be honest with you, everything’s so new and fun. From that standpoint, it’s been great.”
She then added: “There’s nothing more, nothing better in life to wake up in the morning, look at yourself in the mirror and feel comfortable with yourself and who you are.”
Jenner even made a joke about Halloween costumes doing the rounds, which depict the bustier she wore on her famous Vanity Fair cover.
Dressing up ... Caitlyn Jenner-inspired Halloween costumes have sparked outrage by some, but Jenner says she’s ‘in on the joke’. Picture: Supplied/Anytimecostumes.com “I’m in on the joke. I don’t think it’s offensive at all. I know the [transgender] community does and they’ve gotten a lot of criticism for doing it. I think it’s great… [Still] they could have a better looking outfit, you know?” she laughed. “I could have done my own costume! I mean, that was a serious bustier on the cover of Vanity Fair. I mean at least get some good clothes.”
“You’ve got to enjoy life. Life’s too short. I can’t get too upset about that type of stuff,” she said.
Giving back ... Caitlyn Jenner appeared on the premiere episode of the new season of Ellen with Blossom C. Brown, a transgender woman who is hoping to attend nursing school. Picture: Facebook Jenner also addressed the controversy around her receiving the Arthur Ashe Courage Award at this year’s ESPYs, a decision which caused a significant amount of backlash.
“I didn’t ask for it. They gave me the award,” she said.
“Did it take a lot of courage to come out? Absolutely. Did I have tremendous respect for Arthur Ashe and that award? Absolutely.
“And I’m very honored to have them award that to me, not just to me but this entire community. So I’m very pleased the way it turned out.”
Originally published as Jenner scared she’ll land in men’s jail
